com.receiver2d.engine.entitysystem

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.receiver2d.engine.Transform2D
      • com.receiver2d.engine.entitysystem.Entity

  • public class Entity
extends Transform2D
    Contains information regarding an in-game Entity. Any object instantiated in the game is, in its most basic form, an entity with certain capabilities.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected HashMap<String,Component> components
      The components attached to the entity.
      Polygon mesh
      The mesh of the entity.
      String name
      The name of the entity.
      protected Entity parent
      A parent entity to which the entity is attached to.
      Vector2D position
      The current position of the entity.
      Texture2D texture
      The texture of the entity.
      boolean visible
      Whether or not the entity is visible.

        rotation

      Constructor and Description

    • Field Detail

      • components

        protected HashMap<String,Component> components
        The components attached to the entity.

      • parent

        protected Entity parent
        A parent entity to which the entity is attached to.

      • name

        public String name
        The name of the entity.

      • visible

        public boolean visible
        Whether or not the entity is visible. If not, then it will not be rendered in the next draw call.

      • position

        public Vector2D position
        The current position of the entity.

      • mesh

        public Polygon mesh
        The mesh of the entity. Specifies the morphology as an instance of a Polygon. Note that the polygon's individual points are localized to the entity's position.

      • texture

        public Texture2D texture
        The texture of the entity. Specifies the visual morphology as an instance of a Texture.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(String entityName)
        Creates a new Entity (in-game object) and initializes the component list for that entity.

        Creates a new Entity (in-game object) and initializes the component list for that entity.

    • Method Detail

      • createChildEntity

        public Entity createChildEntity()
        Creates an entity whose parent is the calling instance.
        Returns:
        The child entity.

      • setChildEntity

        public void setChildEntity(Entity child)
        Sets an entity to be a child of this entity.
        Parameters:
        child - The child to make as an entity.

      • attachToParent

        public void attachToParent(Entity parentEntity)
        Sets the entity to be a child of the given entity, parent.
        Parameters:
        parentEntity - The parent entity to be a child of.

      • getUuid

        public UUID getUuid()
        Returns a unique ID for this entity.
        Returns:
        A string containing the UUID.

      • attachComponent

        public void attachComponent(Component comp)
        Adds a component to the Component list.
        Parameters:
        name - The component name type.
        comp - The component to add.

      • getComponent

        public Component getComponent(String name)
        Gets the current Component attached to the Entity.
        Parameters:
        name - The current Component attached to the Entity.
        Returns:
        The Component matching the specified name, or null otherwise.

      • removeComponent

        public Component removeComponent(String name)
        Removes a Component from the Entity.
        Parameters:
        name - The Component's name type.
        Returns:
        The removed Component, or null if the Component did not exist.

      • getComponents

        public HashMap<String,Component> getComponents()
        Returns:
        All of the current Component items attached to the entity.

      • getDelocalizedMesh

        public Polygon getDelocalizedMesh()
        Gets the absolute location of the mesh of the entity.
        Returns:
        A new polygon where the position of each point is absolute.
